comments.body: Why 8011?  If we have to change the default, we need to update the README.md to match.
For the e2e tests I used a non-default port for proxying. When I originally tried using the default port, I saw a bunch of "Failed to bind to port 8001" in the logs.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +129,133 @@
# Launch a local proxy to the apiserver
${KUBECTL} proxy --port=8011 &
kubectl_proxy_pid=$!

comments.body: What value does $current_image take on if the `|| true` happens?

Something like:
`pod "44439f5e-6b86-11e4-843e-42010af02fc5" not found`

Def. not something that will match the image name we expect, so the next test is guaranteed to fail.

Put another way, the precedence is `(current_image=$(...)) || true`
OK, that's what I thought. Clearly I'm failing at my life goal of not learning any bash. ;)

comments.body: Is this going to leak into the user's environment? Probably don't want to leave this sitting there.

No -- this'll only be set for the run of this script.  Users aren't going to "source" this so it won't leak outside the script.

The problem was that this needs to be set and passed down to child processes.  that is what `export` does.  I missed this as I already had it exported in the parent bash environment so it got passed down that way.
Pretty sure this may not be true for all users.
Heh -- this is just for the e2e suite.  I have images pre-built.  When running the demo users can use mine or create their own.
